description: From earlier goodby, Godby, Godby'e, Godbwye, God b'w'y, God bwy yee, God buy you, God be wi' you, each a progressively shorter contraction of "God be with ye" or "God be with you". Note the change of God to good by confusion with good morning, good day, etc.

entries.meaning: An utterance of goodbye, the wishing of farewell to someone.
examples: We have time for a short goodbye.

verbs.description: goodbye (third-person singular simple present goodbyes, present participle goodbying or goodbyeing, simple past and past participle goodbyed)

entries.meaning: To say goodbye; to wish somebody farewell on parting.
